intro: Agoseris villosa, commonly known as the hairy agoseris, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. Agoseris villosa produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
